intro: Vallaris assamensis, commonly known as the Assam vallaris, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are borne in axillary inflorescences. Vallaris assamensis is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
